```{r setup}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| error: false
#| results: 'hide'

# Load dashboardr (includes dplyr, highcharter as dependencies)
library(dashboardr)

# Global chunk options
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  echo = FALSE,
  warning = FALSE,
  message = FALSE,
  error = FALSE,
  fig.width = 12,
  fig.height = 8,
  dpi = 300
)

# Load data
data <- readRDS('dataset_2867obs.rds')

# Data summary
cat('Dataset loaded:', nrow(data), 'rows,', ncol(data), 'columns\n')

```

### Filters


```{r}
#| echo: false
#| results: 'asis'
dashboardr::render_input(
  input_id = "region_filter",
  label = "Region:",
  type = "checkbox",
  filter_var = "region_1a",
  options = c("New England", "Middle Atlantic", "E. Nor. Central", "W. Nor. Central", "South Atlantic", "E. Sou. Central", "W. Sou. Central", "Mountain", "Pacific"),
  options_from = NULL,
  default_selected = NULL,
  placeholder = "Select...",
  width = "300px",
  min = 0,
  max = 100,
  step = 1,
  value = NULL,
  show_value = TRUE,
  inline = TRUE,
  toggle_series = NULL,
  override = FALSE,
  labels = NULL,
  size = "md",
  help = NULL,
  disabled = FALSE
)
```

## Column

### Trust Levels by Region

```{r stackedbar-region-1a-trust-1a}
# Trust Levels by Region
result <- viz_stackedbar(
  data = data,
  title = "Trust Levels by Region",
  x_var = "region_1a",
  stack_var = "trust_1a",
  subtitle = "Do you think most people can be trusted?",
  x_label = "Region",
  y_label = "Percentage",
  stack_label = "Trust Level",
  stacked_type = "percent",
  stack_order = c("Can Trust", "Can't Be Too Careful", "Depends"),
  color_palette = c("#27ae60", "#e74c3c", "#f39c12")
)

# Force container height with explicit wrapper
if (inherits(result, 'highchart')) {
  result <- highcharter::hc_size(result, height = 500)
}
result <- htmltools::div(
  style = 'height: 500px !important; min-height: 500px !important; width: 100%; overflow: visible;',
  result
)

result
```

### Trust by Region and Education

```{r heatmap-region-1a-degree-1a}
# Trust by Region and Education
result <- viz_heatmap(
  data = data,
  title = "Trust by Region and Education",
  x_var = "region_1a",
  y_var = "degree_1a",
  value_var = "trust_1a",
  x_label = "Region",
  y_label = "Education Level",
  value_label = "Trust Level",
  y_order = c("Lt High School", "High School", "Junior College", "Bachelor", "Graduate"),
  color_palette = c("#d7191c", "#fdae61", "#ffffbf", "#abdda4", "#2b83ba")
)

# Force container height with explicit wrapper
if (inherits(result, 'highchart')) {
  result <- highcharter::hc_size(result, height = 500)
}
result <- htmltools::div(
  style = 'height: 500px !important; min-height: 500px !important; width: 100%; overflow: visible;',
  result
)

result
```
